metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the ind-def:ldap_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the ind-def:ldap_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the ldap directory can be found by navigating to Start->Run... and type 'ldp' on Windows systems or by using the ldapsearch tool on UNIX systems.

criterion.comment: Test that an ldap_object with only a suffix is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn and attribute is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn where a pattern match is used and attribute is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn and attribute pattern match is used is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with scope behavior is supported.

ldap_test.comment: Test that an ldap_object with only a suffix is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn and attribute is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn where a pattern match is used and attribute is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with a suffix and a relative_dn and attribute pattern match is used is supported.
Test that an ldap_object with scope behavior is supported.

ldap_object.comment: Retrieve the ldap_item with the suffix equal to 'dc=example,dc=org'.
Retrieve the ldap_item with the suffix equal to 'dc=example,dc=org' and the relative_dn equal to 'ou=itim'.
Retrieve the ldap_item with the suffix equal to 'dc=example,dc=org', the relative distinguished name equal to 'ou=itim', and the attribute equal to 'ou'.
Retrieve the ldap_items with the suffix equal to 'dc=example,dc=org', the relative distinguished name matches the regular expression '^o.=i.i.$', and the attribute equals 'ou'.
Retrieve the ldap_items with the suffix 'dc=example,dc=org', the relative distinguished name 'ou=itim', and an attribaute that matches the regular expression '^o[a-z]{1}$'.
Retrieve the ldap_item starting with the suffix 'dc=example,dc=org', the relative distinguished name 'ou=itim', searching one level down, and an attribaute that equals 'ou'.

ldap_state.comment: This state represents an ldap_item that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org'.
This state represents an ldap_item object that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org' and a relative_dn of 'ou=itim'.

This state represents an ldap_item object that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org', a relative distinguished name of 'ou=itim', an attribute 'ou', an object class of 'top;organizationalUnit;', an ldaptype of 'LDAPTYPE_DN_STRING', and a value of 'itim'.

This state represents an ldap_item object that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org', a relative distinguished name that matches the regular expression '.*', an attribute of 'ou', an object class of 'top;organizationalUnit;', an ldaptype of 'LDAPTYPE_DN_STRING', and a value that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This state represents an ldap_item object that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org', a relative distinguished name of 'ou=itim', an attribute that matches the regular expression '^o[a-z]{1}$', an object class that equals 'top;organizationalUnit;', an ldaptype of 'LDAPTYPE_DN_STRING', and a value of 'itim'.

This state represents an ldap_item object that has a suffix of 'dc=example,dc=org', a relative distinguished name of 'ou=constraints,ou=itim', an attribute that equals 'ou', an object class of 'top;organizationalUnit;', an ldaptype of 'LDAPTYPE_DN_STRING', and a value of 'constraints'.
